page.title: 16Village doctor
page.content: Our village doctor... Dr Seth Jones qualified as a doctor 31 years ago.He was born in the town of Neath, moved to London and was evacuated to the village of Llandybie during the war, a village about 8 miles away.he has been our village doctor for 26 years. in 1959 there was only one road which was surfaced with tarmac, all the others were unmade. He remembers a chip shop, a sweet shop and the Cooperative Stores which is now the VG shop. There was also a bakery which was called the Curwen Stores.They also sold meat and vegetables there. It is now a public house called the Baker's Arms.There was also another old public house called the Maerdy. It was built in 1920. This was a beautiful building with old beams and to get to it you had to cross a pack bridge.....
